author: Terry McDonald
comment: Amazing everything now works on Galaxy Edge 7. Powering, remote console very happy thought this was dead in the water but now can monitor my Esxi 6.5 server in the loft easily

author: John Pagourtzis
comment: At last. Soooo long time to fix the power bug. Wake up Dell people use tablets and android phones to do monitor their infrastructure on the go.

author: Ryan Dougherty
comment: Console keeps saying disconnecting and errors out before it even connects. This feature is completely unusable! Galaxy S8+

Useful app for quick VM management. Another excellent product from VMware. One suggestion would be the ability to see which machines are powered on in the machine list under Related Objects / Virtual Macines. Currently have to dig into each machine to see its power state

author: Ross Perry
comment: Getting 'No peer certificate' when  connecting via localhost port forward. Need to be able to trust all certificates again. Works well otherwise

author: NovellGeek
comment: Latest update still doesn't allow connection to console. Crashes every time you connect.

author: Luke Stracey
comment: Well shiver my timber, they've only gone and got it working again after 3 Android major releases have come and gone.

author: Sagar Hindochaa
comment: Finally it can perform power operations on VMs and Hosts - thanks for getting around fixing it after all this wait.....

author: Robin Newborg
comment: While very powerful and one of the best out there I would love to see DPM controls for hosts and the ability for a compute migration of a VM. Solid app!

author: Ivaylo Krumov
comment: Absolutely love this app. This application has tremendous potential to become So big and popular even to become Enterprise Application. PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE DON'T STOP DEVELOPMENT!!!

author: No NAME
comment: App crashes on click start/shutdown button

author: Dave Mutogi
comment: Pixel will not connect but can reach in browser. Allow SSC for clients

author: Anthony H
comment: Amazing!!! Thank you. Quick and easy to use and saves time and provides remote access to VM !!!!! Love it

author: Nathaniel Jeffries
comment: Yay! Works great again. PixelXL.

author: Wolter Bijker
comment: Cannot add more than one Host, maybe i'm missing a setting.

author: kev ward
comment: Great, last update broke console access

author: amer helmy
comment: I have server not responding ? Pls help

author: Chris Davies
comment: Happy days this has finally been updated so it actually works again on my S7!

author: Dave T
comment: Thank you... Finally works on my Nexus 6p and am able to perform vm actions...FINALLY!

author: Patrick Smalley
comment: Awesome! It is nice to have vSphere on my phone, works with the free version too!

author: John Tucker
comment: Problem fixed thanks !!!

author: Kamin Horvath
comment: Works great on my Pixel! Easy way to quickly monitor everything.

author: Ali ZhKhan
comment: Finally its working again.... Awesome

author: Jason Hill
comment: Great app, however not all VMs are displayed.

author: ifeanyi nwabueze
comment: Finally VMWare.... Only took a year to fix but well done for finally getting it done

author: efstathios mesaretzidis
comment: I love VMware's dedication to the products, however their Android team should REALLY focus on a new App, a lot of Pro's out there are using portable devices to control vSphere. If you don't have plans for immediate updating at least kill the app until further notice.
title: Marshmallow crashes

author: Zach Richards
comment: This app use to be great for monitoring my vms. Recently I bought a nexus 6p with Android 6.0 on it and some of the features now cause the app to force close. On my previous phone I could use all the features but on my new phone I can only view my vms. If I try to modify settings or power on/off a VM the app crashes and the command is never sent. Please fix this
title: Force closes

author: Jerrode Miller
comment: This app was 5 stars until a recent upgrade to Android 6.0 renders the app unless. I noticed that whenever you try to turn on, reboot, or turn off a vm the app crashes. I have received the following error " Unfortunately, watchlist has stopped" prompting the app to reboot. Please fix this as soon as possible and I'll give it 5 stars again.
title: Glitches after upgrade to Android 6.0

author: Robert Fitzgerald
comment: Controls seem very hit and miss on the console, touchscreen is difficult to use for Windows guests without a cursor. I'd suggest the developers implement a cursor similar to that found in the Teamviewer mobile app which works very well.
title: Some great features but console needs some work

author: John Hossbach
comment: The bar graphs for VM performance aren't working on ESXi 6.x hosts.  CPU and RAM show 0 and storage shows an incorrect value.  Detailed historical graphs work, though.  Also can't right-click in console.  Decent app for quick information, though.
title: VM Performance Data Not Working

author: Diabolic Preacher
comment: The whole UI and its simplicity for taking care of routine tasks all within my hands was just too cool! However since my phone got updated to marshmallow, any action triggered on any virtual machines are crashing the app. Actions like power on, revert, delete snapshot, etc. Please test and update this.
title: Awesome tool until Android Lollipop

author: Craig Deetlefs
comment: WAS a brilliant app, but does not currently support android 6x. As other users have already mentioned, as soon as one tries to perform an action on a VM such as a reboot or even trying to power on a VM results in app crashing. Please VMware, extend support for android 6 and newer, then this app can easily be rated 4.5 star!

author: Justin Revell
comment: Since updating my mobile to the latest OS the ability to perform and restart functions from within the app have broken. This was a great app but a new version is required urgently so it works on all the latest devices again.
title: App does not work now

author: Aemilianus Kehler
comment: Clean, basic functions, be nice if they could scale the console to fit the screen much like RDP app does from MS.  Also I couldn't see a single option for any types of vMotion, or the ability to view datastores, or manage cluster settings.  Great app with very limited functionality.
title: It's ok

author: Jonathan Rose
comment: The most I can do is view information about the esxi host and the virtual machines. Managing snapshots is a hit or miss and the app crashes if I try anything else (e.g. Power cycle VM)
title: Needs a lot of work!

author: James Allen
comment: Love the idea of the app and it works for checking the status of the servers. But when I try and restart a guest or shutdown a guest or even the host all I get is that the app terminated unexpectedly. It could be that I am running Android 6.0 now and this app might not be updated for it. But please fix!
title: Good app but crashes a lot!

author: Ben Hovinga
comment: I would like to see an option to use my own keyboard when viewing the console. Unable to use the Samsung swype keyboard makes slow to work. Also I cannot use my USB keyboard with this app. I can use it with all of the other apps that use the keyboard the phone is set to. I have not not tried but i have a feeling it will not work with bluetooth or physucally attached keyboards. Long story short, allow me to set the keyboard. Fix this issue and then I will give it 5 stars.
title: Console keyboard is not good.

author: Gary Blackmore
comment: Has a problem every time I try to shutdown guest OS or alter CPU/memory and fails to perform action while logging me out of the server  (Using with esxi 5.5)
title: Good for viewing VM instances

author: Dominick Raimondi
comment: It works well for most things. However I care a lot about sensors data especially temperature. When I check the sensor data it says readings are good buy gives me obscure numbers instead of the actual temperatures. Otherwise everything is good.
title: Works Well For Most Things

author: Uval Lubarsky
comment: Installed and easily connected to multiple hosts, all vm's.  Takes getting used to console navigation, but excellent for mobile access using Nexus 6 w Marshmallow over Sonicwall Mobile Connect.
title: Must Have
